title: Watercolor Artist - October/November 2014 (gnv64)
description:
Watercolor Artist - October/November 2014
English | PDF | 76 pages | 41.3 mb

FEATURES
26 In Plain Sight
Direk Kingnok shares the secrets to bringing busy street scenes to life in luminous, flowing watercolors. BY JESSICA CANTERBURY
36 Defying Expectations
Challenging the use of conventional watercolor tools and techniques, George James pushes the boundaries of figure painting. BY KELLY KANE
42 The Ways of Water
With the glorious views of Salt Spring Island, British Columbia, as her inspiration, Carol Evans paints water in all its forms-from still to raging. BY MICHELLE TAUTE
50 Brushing Up
Five top watercolorists offer a sneak peek at the brushes and the brushstrokes responsible for their signature looks. BY BETH WILLIAMS

COLUMNS
8 Making a Splash
Fire up your creative spirit this season with four hot reads and a treasure trove of Cezanne watercolors. BY JESSICA CANTERBURY
12 Studio Staples
Follow along as a pro puts Golden's new line of watercolors to the test. BY JANE FREEMAN
18 Creativity Workshop
Add compleKity and pizzazz to your paintings by mixing your own neutrals. BY BEV JOZWIAK
22 Meet the Masters
Romantic landscape painter Richard Parkes 800inglon fell in love with Venice and the work of the Italian masters. By CAR OEDING
61 Watercolor Essentials
Create the illusion of depth in your landscapes in five simple steps. BY jOYCE HICKS
